title: Contact
text:

title: Publications
text:
Articles

Openness Effects on the Rule of Law: Size and Patterns of Trade. Accepted for publication in: International Review of Law and Economics, jointly with R. Frensch and R. Horvath. Link
Converging Logics: Coopetitive Ties and Innovation in the Early Clean Transportation Industry. In Guclu Atinc (Ed.), Proceedings of the Seventy-ninth Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, jointly with C. Doblinger & B. Soppe. Link

Calculate Travel Time and Distance with OpenStreetMap Data Using the Open Source Routing Machine (OSRM). The Stata Journal, 16 (2): 416-423, jointly with C. Rust. Link

text:

title: Welcome
text:
I am Stephan Huber a father of four, and a Professor of International Economics and Data Science at the Hochschule Fresenius in Cologne. On this private homepage, I share files and links. My publication list can be found here and here is my CV.
If you encounter any bugs or have any feedback, please feel free to contact me:

title: Welcome
text:
Book me
Feel free to schedule an online appointment with me using this booking tool. The appointment will be set up on Microsoft Teams, and I’ll receive automatic notifications, including any cancellations. If that doesn’t work, or if you have something urgent, please write an email.
If you prefer to meet in person, you can visit me at any time in my office (building 4b, 1th floor, Room 01) at HS Fresenius in Cologne.

title: Welcome
text:
Links

LaTeX template for writing a thesis at the HS Fresenius: Overleaf GitHub

title: Welcome
text:
External Links

Think twice about the quality of the papers that you read and cite and better stay away from predatory journals (information on predatory journals can be found here and in Beall’s List)
Out of the many good resources on how to write a thesis, I find the Writing Tips for Ph. D. Students by John H. Cochrane the most helpful.
ChatGPT and other language models can assist you in doing research. Korinek, A. (2023) shows you some use cases.


About me
I am holding a Diploma in Economics from the University of Regensburg and a Doctoral Degree (summa cum laude) from the University of Trier. I completed postgraduate studies at the Interdisciplinary Graduate Center of Excellence at the IAAEU in Trier. Prior to my current position, I worked amongst others as a research assistant to Prof. Dr. Dr. h.c. Joachim Möller at the University of Regensburg, a post-doc at the Leibniz Institute for East and Southeast European Studies (IOS) in Regensburg, and a freelancer at Charles University in Prague.
I gave lectures at various institutions, including TU Munich, University of Regensburg, Saarland University, and Universities of Applied Sciences in Frankfurt and Augsburg. Additionally, I was active abroad for the University of Cordoba in Spain, University of Perugia, and Petra Christian University in Surabaya, Indonesia. My published work can be found in international journals such as the Canadian Journal of Economics and the Stata Journal.
